name: Test User Insertion
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email) VALUES ('johndoe', 'password123', 'john.doe@example.com');
rationale: To verify that a new user can be successfully added to the Users table.

name: Test Department Insertion with Manager
rationale: To ensure that a department can be created and is correctly associated with a user as a manager.

name: Test Product Insertion
sql: INSERT INTO Products (name, description, price, stock_quantity) VALUES ('Widget', 'A standard widget', 19.99, 100);
rationale: To confirm that a product can be added to the Products table with valid details.

name: Test Order Insertion
sql: INSERT INTO Orders (user_id, status, total) VALUES (1, 'Pending', 99.99);
rationale: To check that an order can be recorded successfully in the Orders table.

name: Test Supplier Insertion
sql: INSERT INTO Suppliers (name, contact_email, phone_number, address) VALUES ('Best Supplies', 'contact@bestsupplies.com', '123-456-7890', '123 Supply St.');
rationale: To validate that a supplier can be added to the Suppliers table.

name: Test Order Item Insertion
sql: INSERT INTO Order_Items (order_id, product_id, quantity, price) VALUES (1, 1, 2, 39.98);
rationale: To ensure that items can be added to an existing order in the Order_Items table.

name: Test Sales Invoice Creation
rationale: To confirm that a sales invoice can be created for an existing order.

name: Test Purchase Invoice Creation
rationale: To check if a purchase invoice can be created linked to a supplier.

name: Test Purchase Order Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Orders (supplier_id, user_id, status, total) VALUES (1, 1, 'Pending', 199.99);
rationale: To ensure that a purchase order can be created referencing both supplier and user.

name: Test Purchase Order Item Insertion
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Order_Items (purchase_order_id, product_id, quantity, price) VALUES (1, 1, 5, 99.95);
rationale: To validate that purchase order items can be associated with an existing purchase order.
